name: Unity Productions Foundation
mission: UPF seeks to counter in society is the prevalence of bigotry and stereotypical depictions of Muslims in film and television and the effect these media caricatures have on social relations in America.
programs: The Great American Muslim Road Trip
UPF Film - The Sultan and the Saint
UPF Film - American Muslims: Facts vs. Fiction
theoryOfChange: Using the power of media and film-based dialogues to break down stereotypes, counter dehumanizing rhetoric, and enhance religious and cultural pluralism.
zakatClaimEvidence: Unity Productions Foundation's donation pages and mission statements detail various methods of giving (online, matching gifts, donor-advised funds, IRA funds, Amana Funds, wills, and trusts) and their purpose (countering bigotry, creating peace through media, producing films, educational campaigns, interfaith dialogue), but there is no explicit mention of 'zakat' or a dedicated zakat fund. The search results do not contain any statements from Unity Productions Foundation indicating they accept zakat donations.

dimension_explanations.alignment: UPF shows medium donor alignment as its mission addresses the urgent religious and cultural need to counter media stereotypes [1]. While it maintains a strong track record in media production, its focus on social relations and narrative change offers a different value proposition than traditional relief organizations [3][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high effectiveness in its niche, maintaining a program expense ratio of 76.1% and reaching global audiences through educational video lessons [1][5]. With total revenue of $2,774,622, UPF focuses on capacity building by conducting teacher workshops and providing discussion guides to maximize the reach of its media content [3][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Unity Productions Foundation counters Muslim stereotypes through high-impact media production and educational outreach.
strengths: High financial transparency and accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100
Strong liquidity with 13.1 months of working capital available
Efficient fundraising operations spending only $0.22 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Unity Productions Foundation (UPF) is a media organization dedicated to addressing bigotry and caricatures of Muslims in film and television to improve social relations in America [1][3]. The foundation operates through diverse programs including 'The Great American Muslim Road Trip' and 'Muslims on Screen and Television' (MOST) to foster cultural understanding [3][5].

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the organization could increase its <cite id="1">independent board member ratio</cite>, which currently stands at 60%.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who believe in the power of media to change social narratives and want to support professional-grade film projects that counter Islamophobia.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects verified reach metrics and industry awards, though long-term behavioral change data is not yet fully quantified.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: UPF creates impact by producing high-quality films that humanize Muslim stories, then leveraging those films through educational workshops and industry consulting to shift public perception.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in media work ensures that content is not just produced, but actually reaches and influences the intended audiences.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With recent revenue declines, additional funding is critical to maintain production quality and expand educational outreach.

strengths.detail: The organization holds an <cite id="1">overall score of 97.97.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a near-perfect commitment to governance and financial reporting.
UPF maintains <cite id="1">13.1 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing a robust buffer against revenue fluctuations.
The foundation demonstrates high efficiency, spending only <cite id="1">$0.22 per $1 raised</cite> in charitable contributions.

strengths_deep_dive: Unity Productions Foundation excels in financial management and transparency, as evidenced by its <cite id="1">perfect score of 100 in Culture</cite> and a <cite id="1">95 in Accountability</cite> from Charity Navigator. This is supported by a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 76.1%</cite>, which is highly competitive for organizations in the religious and cultural sector. Furthermore, the organization has achieved significant industry recognition, including an <cite id="1">Emmy® Award Nomination</cite> for its production 'The Sultan and The Saint', demonstrating that its media output meets high professional standards while fulfilling its social mission.
rich_narrative.summary: Unity Productions Foundation (UPF) is a media-focused nonprofit <cite id="1">founded in 1999</cite> that works to counter Muslim stereotypes through high-impact film production and educational outreach. The organization addresses the prevalence of <cite id="3">bigotry and stereotypical depictions of Muslims</cite> in film and television by providing resources to the entertainment industry and creating content for worldwide broadcast. UPF reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $2,774,622</cite> in 2023, with a significant portion of its funding coming from <cite id="2">contributions totaling $2,610,318</cite>. Its operations are characterized by strong financial health, maintaining <cite id="1">13.1 months of working capital</cite> to ensure organizational stability. Beyond production, UPF engages in educational training, having conducted <cite id="6">25 teacher workshops</cite> to integrate cultural understanding into classrooms. Their media reach is extensive, with some projects achieving <cite id="5">global viewers reached of 150,000,000</cite>. The foundation's work includes the MOST (Muslims on Screen and Television) Resource Center, which serves as a bridge between the American Muslim community and the Hollywood creative industry to ensure more authentic narratives.
